newsitem.title: USA: Excalibur to report Q1 loss, lower revs.
newsitem.headline: Excalibur to report Q1 loss, lower revs.

text.p: Excalibur Technologies Corp said Wednesday it expects to report a first quarter loss and revenue of about $3.4 million, a 15 percent decrease from the $4.0 million reported in the same period a year ago.
Expense figures have not been finalized, but the company said it does not expect to report net income for the first quarter. "You can say we expect a loss," a company spokesman told Reuters.
The information software company said it plans to release final, unaudited results in late May.

Excalibur attributed the revenue drop to a combination of factors including lower-than-expected sales in North America, delays in the ramp-up of a joint venture in Europe, and failure to close a joint development agreement with a business partner.
The company also announced changes in conjunction with a reorganization of the sales force and the formation of a new business unit, the Visual Business Group.
As part of these changes the company said it plans to eliminate about 10 percent of its total workforce.
Excalibur does not expect to record a charge against earnings on the job cuts, a spokesman said.
